lead_paragraph: ESPN said yesterday that it had secured an eight-year renewal for rights to televise Major League Soccer games. The agreement with Soccer United Marketing calls for ESPN2 to televise 26 regular-season and three M.L.S. playoff matches each year during prime time on Thursdays until 2014. ABC, its sister network, will present the league’s opening match, the All-Star Game and the Major League Soccer Cup. The networks did not disclose what they paid for the rights.
